NAPSIVolunteering is easy way to give back the increasing number of older Americans who rely on services and social activities within their community PERIOD



The Figures

The number of older adults in this country is growing at a fast rate PERIOD According to a  report from the U.S PERIOD Administration on Aging there are roughly  million seniors living alone in their homes and nearly . million seniors in nursing homes at any given time PERIOD

The older population numbered . million in  an increase of  percent since  PERIOD Over one in every eight people or . percent of the population is an older American PERIOD

The Facts

Many older adults require assistance with daily activities and report having functional limitations which can make staying in their homes difficult without assistance PERIOD Over  percent of all adults aged  and older had  or more visits to a doctor or other health professional in the 12month span PERIOD Often these limitations in activities because of chronic conditions increase with age PERIOD

To remain active in their communities many seniors rely on programs such as meal delivery adult day activities and other social programs PERIOD Seniors in nursing homes use services to connect with their communities PERIOD These programs often need volunteers PERIOD

The Answer

Volunteering can be a fun and easy way to give back to the community PERIOD

Thats where the Got an Hour Give it Back Campaign comes in PERIOD It was developed by the Aging Networks Volunteer Collaborative through a grant from the U.S PERIOD Administration on Aging to help agencies throughout the country attract volunteers to programs that work with seniors PERIOD The campaigns website includes a search toll to help connect volunteers to opportunities in their neighborhood PERIOD

Volunteering can be as simple as driving an older neighbor to the doctor bringing him a meal or helping her with housework PERIOD You can spend only  minutes of your time but the effect can be infinite PERIOD

The Aging Networks Volunteer Collaborative is a national resource center that helps leaders in the aging and disability networks engage talented older adult volunteers to meet growing needs for services PERIOD The Volunteer Collaborative offers online resources comprehensive training and opportunities for leaders to learn best practices from each other PERIOD

The Info

To find programs and events nearby visit www.GiveitBacktoSeniors.org PERIOD
